import React from 'react'; import Image from "react-bootstrap/Image"; import Explorers from '../../src/Explorers.PNG'; import {Container, Row, Col, Button} from 'react-bootstrap' import ExplorerHome from '../../src/ExplorerHome.png'; import Form from 'react-bootstrap/Form' import FloatingLabel from 'react-bootstrap/FloatingLabel' console.log(Explorers); console.log(ExplorerHome); function Contact() { return(

Become a Teeny Tiny Explorers Host

What is a group host?

A group host volunteers to run and organize the Teeny Tiny Explorers meetings in the county that the group host resides in. The group host may recruit others to volunteer as hosts with them, if they please.

What does a group host do?

Group hosts facilitate conversation, ensure members are treating eachother with respect, organize meetups, and help build the Teeny Tiny Explorers community within their community.

Do group hosts get any support?

Group hosts do get support from regional and national mentors. The mentors are able to help come up with more engaging conversations and activities. Hosts may also collaborate and meet with other hosts in their areas outside their county.

I am interested in being a host, how do I sign up?

To sign up to be a host you will need to fill out the below information and then you will receive information within 48 hours on how to start planning a group launch.
Name Email Phone
Preferred Contact Method
Leave details
); } export default Contact;
